header.title: wxRadioBox

description.p: A radio box item is used to select one of number of mutually exclusive choices. It is displayed as a vertical column or horizontal row of labelled buttons.
This class supports the following styles:
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxControl wxWindow wxEvtHandler

func.fsummary: Returns the index of the selected item or wxNOT_FOUND if no item is selected.

desc.p: Returns the index of the selected item or wxNOT_FOUND if no item is selected.
Return: The position of the current selection.
Remark: This method can be used with single selection list boxes only, you should use wxListBox:getSelections/1 for the list boxes with wxLB_MULTIPLE style.
See: setSelection/2, wxControlWithItems:getStringSelection/1

func.fsummary: Returns the label of the item with the given index.

desc.p: Returns the label of the item with the given index.
Return: The label of the item or an empty string if the position was invalid.

func.fsummary: Sets the selection to the given item.

desc.p: Sets the selection to the given item.
Notice that a radio box always has selection, so n must be valid here and passing wxNOT_FOUND is not allowed.

This function is currently only implemented in wxMSW, wxGTK, wxQT and wxUniversal and always returns true in the other ports.

func.fsummary: Returns true if the item is currently shown or false if it was hidden using show/3.

desc.p: Returns true if the item is currently shown or false if it was hidden using show/3.
Note that this function returns true for an item which hadn't been hidden even if the entire radiobox is not currently shown.
This function is currently only implemented in wxMSW, wxGTK, wxQT and wxUniversal and always returns true in the other ports.
